Bangladesh quota protesters announce nationwide shutdown today, PM Hasina 'regrets' casualties
content: Student protesters advocating for reforms in the government job quota system have declared a nationwide shutdown for Thursday, following incidents involving security forces that resulted in the deaths of six people, including four students, nationwide. Asif Mahmud, a leading coordinator of the movement, announced on Facebook that all establishments, except hospitals and emergency services, will shut down, with only ambulance services allowed to operate.
summary: Student protesters advocating for reforms in the government job quota system have declared a nationwide shutdown for Thursday, following incidents involving security forces that resulted in the deaths of six people, including four students, nationwide. Asif Mahmud, a leading coordinator of the movement, announced on Facebook that all establishments, except hospitals and emergency services, will shut down, with only ambulance services allowed to operate.

title: US union organizing, and unions' election win rate, is surging, NLRB says
content: Recent data from the National Labor Relations Board reveals a surge in union election petitions, with over 2,600 filed this fiscal year, exceeding the previous year's total. Unions have seen a 32% increase in petitions, winning 79% of elections they pursued, up from 76% last year. Despite these gains, union representation among US workers remains historically low. Experts attribute the rise in organizing efforts to pandemic concerns and regulatory shifts favoring unions under the Biden administration.
summary: Recent data from the National Labor Relations Board reveals a surge in union election petitions, with over 2,600 filed this fiscal year, exceeding the previous year's total. Unions have seen a 32% increase in petitions, winning 79% of elections they pursued, up from 76% last year. Despite these gains, union representation among US workers remains historically low. Experts attribute the rise in organizing efforts to pandemic concerns and regulatory shifts favoring unions under the Biden administration.

title: US military ends Gaza floating pier mission to bring aid to Palestinians by sea
Joe Biden says Kamala Harris could lead if his health declines
content: President Joe Biden, addressing ongoing concerns about his age and ability to serve, stated his willingness to transfer power to Vice President Kamala Harris if health issues prevent him from completing a potential second term. In a BET interview, Biden emphasized that such a scenario is unlikely unless a medical condition arises, which he currently does not have. Acknowledging the legitimacy of concerns about his age, Biden, 81, defended his capability to lead and expressed confidence in serving another four years.
summary: President Joe Biden, addressing ongoing concerns about his age and ability to serve, stated his willingness to transfer power to Vice President Kamala Harris if health issues prevent him from completing a potential second term. In a BET interview, Biden emphasized that such a scenario is unlikely unless a medical condition arises, which he currently does not have. Acknowledging the legitimacy of concerns about his age, Biden, 81, defended his capability to lead and expressed confidence in serving another four years.

title: Nancy Pelosi told Biden that he could destroy Democrats' chances of winning: Report
content: Former House Speaker Nancy Pelosi reportedly cautioned President Joe Biden that current polling indicates he may not defeat Donald Trump in the upcoming election. Biden pushed back, citing conflicting polls, and Pelosi sought input from advisor Mike Donilon. While Pelosi did not explicitly suggest Biden drop out, she emphasized the urgency of his decision. The exchange underscores Democratic uncertainties ahead of 2024. Pelosi, now in California, has not spoken to Biden since.
summary: Former House Speaker Nancy Pelosi reportedly cautioned President Joe Biden that current polling indicates he may not defeat Donald Trump in the upcoming election. Biden pushed back, citing conflicting polls, and Pelosi sought input from advisor Mike Donilon. While Pelosi did not explicitly suggest Biden drop out, she emphasized the urgency of his decision. The exchange underscores Democratic uncertainties ahead of 2024. Pelosi, now in California, has not spoken to Biden since.

title: 'Pass the torch': Top Democrat presses Biden to withdraw from presidential race
content: Prominent Democrat Adam Schiff urged President Joe Biden to abandon his reelection bid amid controversy over a planned virtual nomination before the party conference. Schiff's call came ahead of Biden's speech to Latino voters in Nevada. Despite calls from around 20 House Democrats and one senator for Biden to withdraw, he remains resolute in his candidacy, citing polls showing a tight race with Donald Trump. The DNC faces scrutiny over plans for a virtual nomination preceding the convention.
summary: Prominent Democrat Adam Schiff urged President Joe Biden to abandon his reelection bid amid controversy over a planned virtual nomination before the party conference. Schiff's call came ahead of Biden's speech to Latino voters in Nevada. Despite calls from around 20 House Democrats and one senator for Biden to withdraw, he remains resolute in his candidacy, citing polls showing a tight race with Donald Trump. The DNC faces scrutiny over plans for a virtual nomination preceding the convention.

US President Joe Biden tests positive for Covid-19 while campaigning in Las Vegas, has 'mild symptoms'
content: President Joe Biden tested positive for Covid-19 while traveling Wednesday in Las Vegas and is experiencing “mild symptoms” from the infection, the White House said. Press secretary Karine Jean-Pierre said Biden will fly to his home in Delaware, where he will “self-isolate and will continue to carry out all of his duties fully during that time." The news had first been shared by Unidos US President and CEO Janet Murguía, who told guests at the group's convention in Las Vegas that president had sent his regrets and could not appear because he tested positive for the virus.
summary: President Joe Biden tested positive for Covid-19 while traveling Wednesday in Las Vegas and is experiencing “mild symptoms” from the infection, the White House said.
